images.copyright: Blue whale skeleton in the Natural History Museum, London, England (© Bailey-Cooper Photography/Alamy)
images.title: Tail of the whale
images.caption: International Museum Day
images.desc: In the grand Hintze Hall of the Natural History Museum in London, UK, a skeleton named Hope soars overhead—a blue whale caught mid-dive above the heads of awestruck visitors. As we mark International Museum Day, there's no better time to celebrate our world's repositories of history, art, and science. The event emphasizes the importance of museums as a means of cultural exchange, the development of mutual understanding, and cooperation among people.
